oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1947-12-06 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from December 6, 1947. Featuring Ott Devine (announcer), Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Cowboy Copas, Curly Fox, Texas Ruby, Bradley Kincaid, Pap's Jug Band, Johnnie & Jack and their Tennessee Mountain Boys, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Texas Ruby; Pap's Jug Band; Bradley Kincaid
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Unidentified commercial (Ott Devine) -- Opening statement (Ott Devine) -- Theme (Turkey In The Straw, RCC version) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Blues In My Mind (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Louie Buck talks (incomplete) -- [break] -- Louie Buck introduces Texas Ruby -- Foggy River (Texas Ruby) -- Louie Buck introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Wave To Me My Lady (Pap's Jug Band) -- Louie Buck introduces Bradley Kincaid -- Legend Of The Robin's Red Breast (Bradley Kincaid)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Copas, Cowboy; Fox, Curly; Texas Ruby; Kincaid, Bradley; Wilson, Lonnie; Pap's Jug Band; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Bashful Brother Oswald; Easterday, Jess; Jackson, Tommy; Zinkan, Joe; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994;
